physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Axial hypotonia, joint hypermobility, right congenital genu recurvatum (resolved spontaneously within 12 hours), arachnodactyly, and finger joint contractures.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 5 days, axial hypotonia, poor head control, poor sucking, peculiar senile appearance, and multiple facial dysmorphisms were noted. The right genu recurvatum resolved. Despite physiotherapy, finger motility remained limited.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Apgar score 9 and 9 at 1 and 5 minutes.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Facial dysmorphisms including hypertelorism, down-slanting palpebral fissures, ocular exotropia, arched nose with a bulbous nasal tip, high-vaulted palate, short philtrum, down-turned mouth with thin upper lip, micrognathia, and low set ears with enlarged lobes. Heart rhythm regular without murmurs, femoral pulses palpable and symmetrical.
Follow-up echocardiography showed aortic dilation progressing to 18 mm.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Echocardiography at 7 months showed aortic dilation stabilizing at 20 mm; the latest evaluation at 13 months showed dilation progressing to 24.5 mm.
